intro: Wahlenbergia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Wahlenbergia humilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
